html:
Feb 8 (Reuters) - The following are the top stories on the New York Times business pages. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.


- Nvidia NVDA.O, the Silicon Valley chipmaker, has ended its nearly 18-month effort to buy Arm, which licenses chip technology used in most smartphones. https://nyti.ms/34n6rIJ


- The film production and financing company Village Roadshow filed a lawsuit against Warner Bros Entertainment claiming that it rushed the release of the movie to help boost HBO Max subscriptions, a revenue stream Village Roadshow doesn't share in. https://nyti.ms/3gxkJZO


- Amazon AMZN.O has told its corporate employees that it is raising its cap on base cash compensation to $350,000, more than double the previous amount, citing "a particularly competitive labor market", according to an internal announcement viewed by The New York Times. https://nyti.ms/3JcpAf4


- Tesla TSLA.O is facing fresh scrutiny from federal and state regulators about its chief executive's social media posts and allegations of discrimination at its California factory, the company revealed in a securities filing that was made public on Monday. https://nyti.ms/35YJADN


(Compiled by Bengaluru newsroom)

(( globalnewsmonitoring@thomsonreuters.com ))
